page.title: 05Around the Villages
page.content: Honington could be quiet but there is a main road and lots of aeroplanes. You can hear the birds and there are lots of trees around. Half of the houses in Honington are thatched and the rest have slate or tiled roofs. Many of the walls are of flint and some are plaster. The modern houses are mostly made of brick. The village is about a mile and a half from the air-base, and is quite separate, apart from the noise! East of Honington is the small linked village of Sapiston, whilst South is Ixworth Thorpe, the northern part of which contains the local public House, The Royal Oak. In Honington the local pub is The Fox.
